headline: TSLA Q1 Earnings Call: Management Attributes Miss to Factory Upgrades and Tariff Headwinds
summary: Electric vehicle pioneer Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales falling 9.2% year on year to $19.34 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.27 per share was 34.9% below analysts’ consensus estimates. The stock traded up 7.7% to $256.54 following the earnings release and call.

headline: Why Tesla (TSLA) Stock Is Trading Up Today
summary: Shares of electric vehicle pioneer Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) jumped 8.9% in the morning session after CEO Elon Musk announced plans to limit his involvement at the Department of Government Efficiency, suggesting a shift in focus toward his business ventures, especially Tesla. Musk added during the Q1 2025 earnings, "I think starting probably in next month, May, my time allocation to DOGE will drop significantly."

headline: Tesla exec cancels Rome conference trip over security concerns
summary: ROME (Reuters) -A Tesla senior executive has cancelled her attendance at a conference in Rome over fears of protests surrounding the carmaker in response to CEO Elon Musk's right-wing activism.  Tesla cars, infrastructure and offices have recently become targets of vandalism in several countries, including Italy.  Samantha Harris, Tesla's Global Sustainability Lead, had been due to speak at Regenerative Futures, a conference planned in Rome for May 16-17 by the European Institute of Innovation for Sustainability (EIIS).

raw.headline: Tesla exec cancels Rome conference trip over security concerns

Samantha Harris, Tesla's Global Sustainability Lead, had been due to speak at Regenerative Futures, a conference planned in Rome for May 16-17 by the European Institute of Innovation for Sustainability (EIIS).

headline: Why Tesla Stock Shot Higher After Elon Musk's Comments
summary: Not many people expected an earnings beat from Tesla's (NASDAQ: TSLA) first-quarter report last night.  The source of investor optimism was in the company's earnings call to discuss the results.  The stock had been dropping as investor concerns grew over the amount of time CEO Elon Musk was spending in his role as head of the cost-cutting, efficiency-boosting Donald Trump initiative called DOGE (Department of Government Efficiency), and the negative reaction to his government work.

headline: Asian shares jump on hopes tariff war may subside and Trump won't fire Federal Reserve chief
summary: Asian shares mostly rose Wednesday, with markets showing relief after President Donald Trump indicated he won't dismiss the head of the U.S. Federal Reserve.  Hong Kong's Hang Seng added 1.7% to 21,927.92, while the Shanghai Composite was little changed, down less than 0.1% at 3,298.33.  Trump had previously said he could fire Fed chair Jerome Powell after the Fed paused cuts to short-term interest rates.

raw.headline: Asian shares jump on hopes tariff war may subside and Trump won't fire Federal Reserve chief
raw.summary: Asian shares mostly rose Wednesday, with markets showing relief after President Donald Trump indicated he won't dismiss the head of the U.S. Federal Reserve.  Hong Kong's Hang Seng added 1.7% to 21,927.92, while the Shanghai Composite was little changed, down less than 0.1% at 3,298.33.  Trump had previously said he could fire Fed chair Jerome Powell after the Fed paused cuts to short-term interest rates.

headline: Tesla shares rise 6.5%, Musk says to cut back DOGE work
summary: LONDON -Tesla shares rose 6.5% in Frankfurt on Wednesday, after it reported profitability for its core auto business topped rock-bottom expectations in the first quarter, although it missed on other...

headline: Musk says Tesla's Optimus humanoid robots affected by China's export curbs on rare earths
summary: (Reuters) -Tesla CEO Elon Musk said on Tuesday that the production of its Optimus humanoid robots had been affected by China's export restrictions of rare earth magnets.  He said China wants assurances that its rare earth magnets are not used for military purposes, adding that the automaker is working with Beijing to get an export license to use rare earth magnets.
